result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry Lee Anderson Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $12,289.00 to Aleco Machinery.  To be paid first before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.

Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already done so.
Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.
DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Balance during the term of Extended Supervision.  Faiure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
Mental health unit to supervise.
Mental health evaluation. Comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy.  Random screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms, further defendant advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerry Lee Anderson Sr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (41 pages) commencing 06-15-2016 PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  36  months with  78  days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  12  months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  24  months.  

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

-  Court sets Restitution in the amount of $12,289

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  Mental Health unit to supervise
-  Referral to Vocational Rehabilitation dept.
-  Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Random screens
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $12,289 to Aleco Machinery during the term of extended supervision.  Restitution to be paid before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Jerry Lee Anderson in court with Attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Jerry Lee Anderson in custody.  Jeremy Robert Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY   and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders uncharged incident read-in to the record and read-in as to sentencing.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Clerk:  jms
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Jerry Lee Anderson not in court, in custody.  Jeremy Robert Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case could not proceed to plea and sentencing on today's date as Atty. Leija is in trial in another court on an unrelated case.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

Case could not proceed to plea and sentencing on today's date due to court calendar congestion.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

Waukesha County.

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court sets bail at $2,500 cash.  All other conditions to remain as previously set:

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Attorney Calvin Malone, appearing for Atty. Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Jerry Lee Anderson not in court, in custody.  Jeremy Robert Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
Parties in court for return on warrant.
Defendant is currently serving a sentence in Waukesha County.

Court will withdraw warrant and set bail.
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

Return on warrant scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is being produced from Waukesha County.
Parties request adjournment to March 25, 2016.

Telephone call received from Asst. District Atty. J. Arn requesting case be scheduled for return on warrant.
Case adjourned for return on warrant in Branch 28 on March 24, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.  State to have defendant produced for the next court date.
No reply from defendant or surety.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($250.00) gj

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failed to appear.  Court ordered the bench warrant that was stayed on October 6, 2015 to be lifted.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED to Court.  Court ordered cash bail on deposit be forfeited.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wask taken into custody on last court date on an MPD warrant.  Defendant did not get notice of this court date.  Defendant coming in to the DA's office for a charging conference sometime next week.  Court ordered a bench warrant but stayed issuance of bench warrant until next court date.  Status conference scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Discharge Summary Report received and filed.

Defendant Jerry Lee Anderson in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in Court and was taken into custody by the City of Milwaukee Police Department for a violation of a restraining order.  Matter rescheduled for a projected guilty plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Report received and filed.  Defendant informed Justice Point that he was in hospital.  Justice Point confirmed.

Defendant Jerry Lee Anderson in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an adjournment of the currently scheduled plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jerry Lee Anderson in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waiting for the state to produce a disk.  Matter adjourned.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jerry Lee Anderson in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however Branch 21 is in jury trial, case adjourned.  Defense counsel is still waiting for some discovery. Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 01:30 am.

Defendant Jerry Lee Anderson in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  
Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Defendant in compliance with Justice Point supervision at this time.
  Plea hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Jerry Lee Anderson in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Ronald Dague for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/6/15.
